column3: modern sports betting originated in 19th century competitive walking, called pedestrianism. Pedestrianism started when English aristocracy would match their servants against each other in walking contests and bet heavily on the outcome.

modern sports betting originated in 19th century competitive walking, called pedestrianism. Pedestrianism started when English aristocracy would match their servants against each other in walking contests and bet heavily on the outcome.
Bill Gates has donated 28 billion dollars since 2007 and saved at least 6 million lives.
a traffic jam in China lasted lasted for more than 10 days, 100 kilometers long, with cars moving less that a kilometer a day.
Mark Twain had an almost fatal heart attack in 1898 after watching a belly dancer's routine.
during decommunization, a statue of Lenin in Ukraine was changed to Darth Vader.
dogs can be trained in sign language

in 1915, scam artist Charles Hatfield convinced the town of San Diego that he could create rainfall using a secret mix of chemicals. The city offered to pay him $10,000 if he could end their drought, and the 'result,' a few days later, was the town's worst flood of the 20th century.
a 2015 study found that people posting duck face pictures are more likely to be associated with neuroticism and emotional instability.
the Ancient Egyptians had a calendar of 12 months, each 30 days long, with 5 days of festivities at the end of the year to add up to 365.

the Cuban missile crisis started when the United States noticed Cubans building football fields, because they knew Cubans preferred baseball over football. The fields were built for Soviet military camps in Cuba.
